title: Fairly heavy showers expected today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showery condition is expected to be enhanced in the Southwestern part of the island from today (29) evening.

title: US court blocks Trump’s sweeping tariffs, citing overreach of authority
byline: A U.S. trade court on Wednesday blocked President Donald Trump’s tariffs from going into effect, ruling that the president overstepped his authority by imposing across-the-board duties on imports from nations that sell more to the United States than they buy.

title: Draft Bill gazetted to establish Gambling Regulatory Authority
byline: The draft bill to establish a Gambling Regulatory Authority has been gazetted under the directives of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.

title: Elon Musk leaves White House but says Doge will continue
byline: Elon Musk has said he is leaving the Trump administration after helping lead a tumultuous drive to shrink size of US government that saw thousands of federal jobs axed.

title: Trump administration to ‘aggressively’ revoke visas of Chinese students
byline: President Donald Trump’s administration says it will “aggressively” revoke the visas of Chinese students studying in the US.

title: Civil Aviation employees withdraw from overtime duties
byline: The Association of Civil Aviation Employees has resorted to trade union action from midnight yesterday (28), in protest over issues related to their overtime (OT) payments.

title: No data lost or harmed in cyberattack on info system: Pensions Dept
byline: The Department of Pensions has stated that no data was damaged or lost in the recent cyberattack on its information systems.

title: Shooting incident reported in Panadura, one injured
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in Wekada, Panadura, police said.

title: Ex-Minister Duminda Dissanayake further remanded
byline: Former Minister Duminda Dissanayake has been further remanded until 5 June in relation to the case filed over the discovery of a firearm from an apartment complex in Havelock Town.

title: China’s Mango TV produces major reality show to spotlight Sri Lanka to the world
byline: In a milestone collaboration for Sri Lanka’s tourism industry, the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau (SLTPB) has successfully completed filming for ‘Serendipitous Journeys”, a Chinese reality series produced by Mango TV, one of China’s most influential digital platforms.

title: Mahindananda sentenced to 20 years RI; Nalin Fernando gets 25 years RI
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced former Sports Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage to 20 years and former Sathosa Chairman Nalin Fernando to 25 years of rigorous imprisonment...

title: Cannot rule out new COVID-19 variants entering Sri Lanka: Health Secretary
byline: Secretary to the Ministry of Health Dr. Anil Jasinghe says although there is no need for the general public to panic at present, he cannot rule out new COVID-19 variants from entering the country. MORE

title: Body of male found floating in Olupattawa Lake
byline: A body of a male has been found floating in Olupattawa Lake in Siyabalagoda, Kahathuduwa, police said.

title: Southeast Asia sees Covid-19 surge, India reports over 1,000 active cases
byline: Active Covid-19 cases have crossed the 1,000-mark in India, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) has said.

title: Investigation committee reveals main cause of Kotmale bus accident that killed 23
byline: The experts’ committee appointed to investigate the cause of fatal bus crash in Gerandi Ella, Kotmale, has identified driver fatigue as the primary cause of the accident, citing a violation of mandatory rest regulations under the Motor Traffic Act.

title: President meets DCC Chairpersons to gather proposals for 2026 Budget
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has held discussions with Chairpersons of District Coordination Committees and senior officials of the Ministry of Finance to obtain proposals and ideas for the 2026 Budget 2026 during a meeting held at the Presidential Secretariat today (29).

title: Committee probing Deshabandu Tennakoon meets, agrees on dates to hear evidence
byline: The Committee of Inquiry to inquire and report its findings on suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon in respect of acts of gross abuse of power has convened once again at the Parliamentary Complex.

title: Ven. Bandarawela Amithananda Thero passes away
byline: Prominent preacher Venerable Bandarawela Amithananda Thero, who was receiving treatment at the Colombo National Hospital due to an illness, has passed away this afternoon (29).

title: BOC employees to withdraw from services in protest over allowance cuts
byline: The Ceylon Bank Employees’ Union says it has decided to withdraw from services in protest against the decision to reduce employee bonuses.

title: ‘Red’ warning issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a ‘Red’ warning for strong winds and rough seas for the sea areas off the coast extending from Chilaw to Kankasanthurai via Puttalam and Mannar and from Galle to Pottuvil via Hambanthota.

title: Keheliya’s daughter Amali Rambukwella at Bribery Commission
byline: The daughter of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, Amali Rambukwella has appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) to record a statement.

title: 16 OICs transferred and assigned to new positions
byline: A total of 16 Officers-in-Charge (OICs) of Sri Lanka Police have been transferred and assigned to new positions with immediate effect.

title: Over 1,700kg of heroin and ‘Ice’ seized from fishing trawlers in 2025
byline: Sri Lanka Police says that a total of 1,758 kilograms of heroin and ‘Ice’ drugs (crystal methamphetamine) smuggled into the country by drug traffickers on multi-day fishing boats has been seized during the raids carried out so far in 2025.

title: 24-hour passport issuance for one-day service to end on May 30
byline: The 24-hour issuance of the one-day passport service at the Department of Immigration and Emigration will end effective from tomorrow (May 30), the department announced.

title: Apple to launch iOS 26, macOS 26 in major rebrand tied to software redesigns
byline: Apple Inc. is planning the most sweeping change yet to its operating system names, part of a software overhaul that extends to all its devices.

title: Anudi makes history for Sri Lanka in Miss World Multimedia Challenge
byline: Anudi Gunasekara has made history for Sri Lanka by clinching the title of First Runner-Up from Asia in the Miss World Multimedia Challenge, marking a proud and unprecedented achievement for the nation at the 72nd Miss World Festival held in Telangana, India.

title: Six arrested over shooting of Thusitha Halloluwa’s vehicle remanded
byline: A total of six individuals arrested over the shooting incident targeting the vehicle of former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa, have been remanded until June 12, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Court grants permission to detain and question 11 arrested with 778kg of narcotics
byline: Court today granted permission to the Police Narcotic Bureau (PNB) to detain and question the 11 individuals arrested following the seizure of two multi-day fishing trawlers in deep seas off Sri Lanka’s southern coast on Tuesday (27) while transporting approximately 778 kilograms of heroin and ‘Ice’ narcotics.

title: Showery conditions to enhance in south-western part of island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showery conditions are expected to be enhanced in the South-western part of the island from this evening (29).

title: Asian Athletics Championships: Sri Lanka clinches Bronze in Women’s 400m Relay
byline: Sri Lanka has secured a bronze medal in the Women’s 4x400m Relay at the 26th Asian Athletics Championships, held in Gumi, South Korea.

title: China eyes more investments in Sri Lanka due to current transparent governance: Chinese Minister
byline: The Minister of Commerce of the People’s Republic of China, Wang Wentao, who is currently on an official visit to Sri Lanka, has met with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this afternoon (29) at the Presidential Secretariat for discussions.
